intro: Arthrostylidium bartlettii, commonly known as the Bartlett's hairless grass, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Poaceae family, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, typical of the grass family. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
